meanings.definition: (ラテン語)奪う、取り除く、剥奪する

etymology.value: ラテン語の「privare」（奪う、取り除く）に接頭辞「de-」（分離、除去）が付いたもの。

verb_forms.present_indicative: deprivo, deprivas, deprivat, deprivamus, deprivatis, deprivant
verb_forms.imperfect_indicative: deprivabam, deprivabas, deprivabat, deprivabamus, deprivabatis, deprivabant
verb_forms.future_indicative: deprivabo, deprivabis, deprivabit, deprivabimus, deprivabitis, deprivabunt
verb_forms.perfect_indicative: deprivavi, deprivavisti, deprivavit, deprivavimus, deprivavistis, deprivaverunt
verb_forms.pluperfect_indicative: deprivaveram, deprivaveras, deprivaverat, deprivaveramus, deprivaveratis, deprivaverant
verb_forms.future_perfect_indicative: deprivavero, deprivaveris, deprivaverit, deprivaverimus, deprivaveritis, deprivaverint

usage_notes.explanation: 「deprivare」は、古典ラテン語において、何かを奪う、取り除く、剥奪するという意味を持つ動詞です。現代英語の「deprive」の語源となっています。

readability_explanation.text: This entry describes a Latin word. Readability assessment is not applicable.

example_sentences.translation: 兵士たちは食糧を奪われた。
example_sentences.english_translation: The soldiers were deprived of food.
